DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course No Surgery Reason Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records the reason that no surgery was performed on the primary site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course No Surgery Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The reason that no surgery was performed on the primary site.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question._A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It is unknown if surgery of the primary site was recommended or performed. Death certificate-only cases and autopsy-only cases.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It is unknown if surgery of the primary site was recommended or performed. Death certificate-only cases and autopsy-only cases.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: It is unknown if surgery of the primary site was recommended or performed. Death certificate-only cases and autopsy-only cases.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgery of the primary site was recommended, but it is unknown if it was performed. Further followup is recommended.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgery of the primary site was recommended, but it is unknown if it was performed. Further followup is recommended.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery of the primary site was recommended, but it is unknown if it was performed. Further followup is recommended.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgery of the primary site was not recommended/performed because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (comorbid conditions, advanced age, etc.).

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgery of the primary site was not recommended/performed because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (comorbid conditions, advanced age, etc.).
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery of the primary site was not recommended/performed because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (comorbid conditions, advanced age, etc.).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgery of the primary site was not performed because the patient died prior to planned or recommended surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgery of the primary site was not performed because the patient died prior to planned or recommended surgery.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery of the primary site was not performed because the patient died prior to planned or recommended surgery.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgery of the primary site was not performed because it was not part of the planned first-course treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgery of the primary site was not performed because it was not part of the planned first-course treatment.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery of the primary site was not performed because it was not part of the planned first-course treatment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgery of the primary site was performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgery of the primary site was performed.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery of the primary site was performed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgery of the primary site was not performed; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgery of the primary site was not performed; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery of the primary site was not performed; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgery of the primary site was not performed; it was recommended by the patient' physician, but was not performed as part of the first-course therapy. No reason was noted in the patient's record.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgery of the primary site was not performed; it was recommended by the patient' physician, but was not performed as part of the first-course therapy. No reason was noted in the patient's record.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Surgery of the primary site was not performed; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but
was not performed as part of the first-course therapy. No reason was noted in the patient's record.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
